unnormalised: ## Don't Get Naive! Rental Agreements are Your Dost in Mumbai's Mayhem!
normalised: ## Don't Get Naive! Rental Agreements are Your Dost in Mumbai's Mayhem!

unnormalised: Hey guys, renting in Mumbai (or anywhere in India, really) can feel like navigating a chaotic Diwali bazaar. You're excited, maybe a little overwhelmed, and surrounded by a whole lot of noise. But before you hand over that security deposit to Mr. Sharma for that sweet 1BHK near Dadar station, listen up! Get a rental agreement!
normalised: Hey guys, renting in Mumbai (or anywhere in India, really) can feel like navigating a chaotic Diwali bazaar. You're excited, maybe a little overwhelmed, and surrounded by a whole lot of noise. But before you hand over that security deposit to Mister Sharma for that sweet one B H K near Dadar station, listen up! Get a rental agreement!

unnormalised: Think of it as your best friend, your guide, your shield against any potential *dhokha*. It's the legally binding document that protects both you (the tenant) and the landlord.
normalised: Think of it as your best friend, your guide, your shield against any potential *dhokha*. It's the legally binding document that protects both you (the tenant) and the landlord.

unnormalised: What's even in it, you ask? Well, it should clearly outline:
normalised: What's even in it, you ask? Well, it should clearly outline:

unnormalised: *   **The Rent & Deposit:** How much you're paying (e.g., Rs. 15,000 per month), the security deposit (usually a few months' rent), and how and when it'll be returned (important!). My friend Priya didn't get hers back for 6 months because it wasn't clearly stated!
normalised: *   **The Rent and Deposit:** How much you're paying (e.g., rupees fifteen thousand per month), the security deposit (usually a few months' rent), and how and when it'll be returned (important!). My friend Priya didn't get hers back for six months because it wasn't clearly stated!

unnormalised: *   **Duration of the Agreement:** Is it an 11-month agreement (common in India to avoid registration hassles), a 1-year lease, or longer? What's the lock-in period? All critical!
normalised: *   **Duration of the Agreement:** Is it an eleven-month agreement (common in India to avoid registration hassles), a one-year lease, or longer? What's the lock-in period? All critical!

unnormalised: *   **Responsibilities:** Who's responsible for what? Who pays for plumbing issues? What about that leaky roof during the monsoon? Spell it out!
normalised: *   **Responsibilities:** Who's responsible for what? Who pays for plumbing issues? What about that leaky roof during the monsoon? Spell it out!

unnormalised: *   **Termination Clause:** How much notice do you need to give if you want to leave early? What happens if Mr. Sharma suddenly decides to sell the property on 26/01/2024?
normalised: *   **Termination Clause:** How much notice do you need to give if you want to leave early? What happens if Mister Sharma suddenly decides to sell the property on twenty sixth january two thousand and twenty four?

unnormalised: *   **Any other clauses:** Parking spots, pet rules (if your furry friend, Sheru, is joining you), guest restrictions - cover all your bases.
normalised: *   **Any other clauses:** Parking spots, pet rules (if your furry friend, Sheru, is joining you), guest restrictions - cover all your bases.

unnormalised: Getting it done right is crucial. You can draft one yourself, download a template, or get a lawyer. Online platforms can help too, but always double-check everything. Make sure it's stamped and registered if it's for a longer period.
normalised: Getting it done right is crucial. You can draft one yourself, download a template, or get a lawyer. Online platforms can help too, but always double-check everything. Make sure it's stamped and registered if it's for a longer period.

unnormalised: Landlords will often want it notarized by 10:00 hrs on 02/10/2023. Don't skip this step! Think of it as getting your Aadhar card for your housing situation. It adds an extra layer of legal security.
normalised: Landlords will often want it notarized by ten zero zero hours on second october two thousand and twenty three. Don't skip this step! Think of it as getting your Aadhar card for your housing situation. It adds an extra layer of legal security.

unnormalised: Remember, a little bit of effort upfront can save you a lot of headaches (and potentially, a lot of Rs.) down the line. So, grab your chai, sit down with Mr. Sharma, and get that rental agreement sorted. You’ll thank me later! And for god's sake, read the fine print! Jai Hind!
normalised: Remember, a little bit of effort upfront can save you a lot of headaches (and potentially, a lot of rupees) down the line. So, grab your chai, sit down with Mister Sharma, and get that rental agreement sorted. You’ll thank me later! And for god's sake, read the fine print! Jai Hind!
